intro: Prostanthera monticola, commonly known as mountain mint, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its aromatic, glandular leaves and small, tubular flowers that are typically pale blue or purple in color. It is typically found in rocky or sandy soils in elevated areas, often in open woodlands or heathlands. Prostanthera monticola is valued for its ornamental appeal and has some traditional uses in indigenous medicine.
